Be it known to you even international organizations give weight to problem of drug trafficking on the territory of my native Tajikistan. At last their official representatives agree that the south of this country turned into "heroin anclave" especially after Russian frontiersmen had left their positions there. Take, for example, the words of spokesman from European branch of International Counternarcotic Actions Organization, who has recently visited Tajikistan and agreed to share his impressions with journalists. He said the following. "Those, who must fight against drug dealers, are terrified to death. Roads, mountain passes, kishlaks around the border and all pathways are divided among not local Mafiosi but among field commanders of Afghan Mujahideen. Certainly I am not indifferent to fate of local youth, but I'd stress that Europe is more liable to this evil than people of this region. And in a few years we'll have a lot of babies with Down's syndrome in Old World maternities".
 He said that he incriminated present conditions as one cause of US direct connivance, because it was Washington that proclaimed USA the guarantor of democratic changes in Afghanistan.
 Then he dipped up a scandal, connected with White House links with contras (Narcotics for Weapons), from memory and said that he offered prayers in order that his fears wouldn't be justified. In this case I fully agree with him.
